intro: Podospermum meshhedense, commonly known as the Meshhed nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, followed by berries that are toxic to humans and animals. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
